p: This family includes 32 genera and around 200 species mainly distributed in pantropical and a few species in subtropical and temperate regions. The group includes trees and shrubs, with several species widely employed in folk medicine to treat malaria, viral diseases, diabetes, and gastritis, among others. The most popular species from this family is the tree of heaven ( Ailanthus altissima), which is considered a noxious and invasive tree that has widely colonized Europe and North America.
